71  /**
72   * Test HStoreFile
73   */
74  @Category(SmallTests.class)
75  public class TestStoreFile extends HBaseTestCase {
76    static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(TestStoreFile.class);
77    private CacheConfig cacheConf =  new CacheConfig(conf);
78    private String ROOT_DIR;
79    private Map<String, Long> startingMetrics;
80  
81    private static final ChecksumType CKTYPE = ChecksumType.CRC32;
82    private static final int CKBYTES = 512;
83  
84    @Override
85    public void setUp() throws Exception {
86      super.setUp();
87      startingMetrics = SchemaMetrics.getMetricsSnapshot();
88      ROOT_DIR = new Path(this.testDir, "TestStoreFile").toString();
89    }
90  
91    @Override
92    public void tearDown() throws Exception {
93      super.tearDown();
94      SchemaMetrics.validateMetricChanges(startingMetrics);
95    }
96  
97    /**
98     * Write a file and then assert that we can read from top and bottom halves
99     * using two HalfMapFiles.
100    * @throws Exception
101    */
102   public void testBasicHalfMapFile() throws Exception {
103     // Make up a directory hierarchy that has a regiondir ("7e0102") and familyname.
104     Path outputDir = new Path(new Path(this.testDir, "7e0102"),
105         "familyname");
106     StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf,
107         this.fs, 2 * 1024)
108             .withOutputDir(outputDir)
109             .build();
110     writeStoreFile(writer);
111     checkHalfHFile(new StoreFile(this.fs, writer.getPath(), conf, cacheConf,
112         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE));
113   }
114 
115   private void writeStoreFile(final StoreFile.Writer writer) throws IOException {
116     writeStoreFile(writer, Bytes.toBytes(getName()), Bytes.toBytes(getName()));
117   }
118 
119   // pick an split point (roughly halfway)
120   byte[] SPLITKEY = new byte[] { (LAST_CHAR-FIRST_CHAR)/2, FIRST_CHAR};
121 
122   /*
123    * Writes HStoreKey and ImmutableBytes data to passed writer and
124    * then closes it.
125    * @param writer
126    * @throws IOException
127    */
128   public static void writeStoreFile(final StoreFile.Writer writer, byte[] fam, byte[] qualifier)
129   throws IOException {
130     long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
131     try {
132       for (char d = FIRST_CHAR; d <= LAST_CHAR; d++) {
133         for (char e = FIRST_CHAR; e <= LAST_CHAR; e++) {
134           byte[] b = new byte[] { (byte) d, (byte) e };
135           writer.append(new KeyValue(b, fam, qualifier, now, b));
136         }
137       }
138     } finally {
139       writer.close();
140     }
141   }
142 
143   /**
144    * Test that our mechanism of writing store files in one region to reference
145    * store files in other regions works.
146    * @throws IOException
147    */
148   public void testReference()
149   throws IOException {
150     // Make up a directory hierarchy that has a regiondir ("7e0102") and familyname.
151     Path storedir = new Path(new Path(this.testDir, "7e0102"), "familyname");
152     // Make a store file and write data to it.
153     StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf,
154         this.fs, 8 * 1024)
155             .withOutputDir(storedir)
156             .build();
157     writeStoreFile(writer);
158     StoreFile hsf = new StoreFile(this.fs, writer.getPath(), conf, cacheConf,
159         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
160     StoreFile.Reader reader = hsf.createReader();
161     // Split on a row, not in middle of row.  Midkey returned by reader
162     // may be in middle of row.  Create new one with empty column and
163     // timestamp.
164     KeyValue kv = KeyValue.createKeyValueFromKey(reader.midkey());
165     byte [] midRow = kv.getRow();
166     kv = KeyValue.createKeyValueFromKey(reader.getLastKey());
167     byte [] finalRow = kv.getRow();
168     // Make a reference
169     Path refPath = StoreFile.split(fs, storedir, hsf, midRow, Range.top);
170     StoreFile refHsf = new StoreFile(this.fs, refPath, conf, cacheConf,
171         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
172     // Now confirm that I can read from the reference and that it only gets
173     // keys from top half of the file.
174     HFileScanner s = refHsf.createReader().getScanner(false, false);
175     for(boolean first = true; (!s.isSeeked() && s.seekTo()) || s.next();) {
176       ByteBuffer bb = s.getKey();
177       kv = KeyValue.createKeyValueFromKey(bb);
178       if (first) {
179         assertTrue(Bytes.equals(kv.getRow(), midRow));
180         first = false;
181       }
182     }
183     assertTrue(Bytes.equals(kv.getRow(), finalRow));
184   }
185 
186   public void testHFileLink() throws IOException {
187     final String columnFamily = "f";
188 
189     Configuration testConf = new Configuration(this.conf);
190     FSUtils.setRootDir(testConf, this.testDir);
191 
192     HRegionInfo hri = new HRegionInfo(Bytes.toBytes("table-link"));
193     Path storedir = new Path(new Path(this.testDir,
194       new Path(hri.getTableNameAsString(), hri.getEncodedName())), columnFamily);
195 
196     // Make a store file and write data to it.
197     StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(testConf, cacheConf,
198          this.fs, 8 * 1024)
199             .withOutputDir(storedir)
200             .build();
201     Path storeFilePath = writer.getPath();
202     writeStoreFile(writer);
203     writer.close();
204 
205     Path dstPath = new Path(this.testDir, new Path("test-region", columnFamily));
206     HFileLink.create(testConf, this.fs, dstPath, hri, storeFilePath.getName());
207     Path linkFilePath = new Path(dstPath,
208                   HFileLink.createHFileLinkName(hri, storeFilePath.getName()));
209 
210     // Try to open store file from link
211     StoreFile hsf = new StoreFile(this.fs, linkFilePath, testConf, cacheConf,
212         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
213     assertTrue(hsf.isLink());
214 
215     // Now confirm that I can read from the link
216     int count = 1;
217     HFileScanner s = hsf.createReader().getScanner(false, false);
218     s.seekTo();
219     while (s.next()) {
220       count++;
221     }
222     assertEquals((LAST_CHAR - FIRST_CHAR + 1) * (LAST_CHAR - FIRST_CHAR + 1), count);
223   }
224 
225   /**
226    * Validate that we can handle valid tables with '.', '_', and '-' chars.
227    */
228   public void testStoreFileNames() {
229     String[] legalHFileLink = { "MyTable_02=abc012-def345", "MyTable_02.300=abc012-def345",
230       "MyTable_02-400=abc012-def345", "MyTable_02-400.200=abc012-def345",
231       "MyTable_02=abc012-def345_SeqId_1_", "MyTable_02=abc012-def345_SeqId_20_" };
232     for (String name: legalHFileLink) {
233       assertTrue("should be a valid link: " + name, HFileLink.isHFileLink(name));
234       assertTrue("should be a valid StoreFile" + name, StoreFile.validateStoreFileName(name));
235       assertFalse("should not be a valid reference: " + name, StoreFile.isReference(name));
236 
237       String refName = name + ".6789";
238       assertTrue("should be a valid link reference: " + refName, StoreFile.isReference(refName));
239       assertTrue("should be a valid StoreFile" + refName, StoreFile.validateStoreFileName(refName));
240     }
241 
242     String[] illegalHFileLink = { ".MyTable_02=abc012-def345", "-MyTable_02.300=abc012-def345",
243       "MyTable_02-400=abc0_12-def345", "MyTable_02-400.200=abc012-def345...." };
244     for (String name: illegalHFileLink) {
245       assertFalse("should not be a valid link: " + name, HFileLink.isHFileLink(name));
246     }
247   }
248 
249   /**
250    * This test creates an hfile and then the dir structures and files to verify that references
251    * to hfilelinks (created by snapshot clones) can be properly interpreted.
252    */
253   public void testReferenceToHFileLink() throws IOException {
254     final String columnFamily = "f";
255 
256     Path rootDir = FSUtils.getRootDir(conf);
257 
258     String tablename = "_original-evil-name"; // adding legal table name chars to verify regex handles it.
259     HRegionInfo hri = new HRegionInfo(Bytes.toBytes(tablename));
260     // store dir = <root>/<tablename>/<rgn>/<cf>
261     Path storedir = new Path(new Path(rootDir,
262       new Path(hri.getTableNameAsString(), hri.getEncodedName())), columnFamily);
263 
264     // Make a store file and write data to it. <root>/<tablename>/<rgn>/<cf>/<file>
265     StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf,
266          this.fs, 8 * 1024)
267             .withOutputDir(storedir)
268             .build();
269     Path storeFilePath = writer.getPath();
270     writeStoreFile(writer);
271     writer.close();
272 
273     // create link to store file. <root>/clone/region/<cf>/<hfile>-<region>-<table>
274     String target = "clone";
275     Path dstPath = new Path(rootDir, new Path(new Path(target, "7e0102"), columnFamily));
276     HFileLink.create(conf, this.fs, dstPath, hri, storeFilePath.getName());
277     Path linkFilePath = new Path(dstPath,
278                   HFileLink.createHFileLinkName(hri, storeFilePath.getName()));
279 
280     // create splits of the link.
281     // <root>/clone/splitA/<cf>/<reftohfilelink>,
282     // <root>/clone/splitB/<cf>/<reftohfilelink>
283     Path splitDirA = new Path(new Path(rootDir,
284         new Path(target, "571A")), columnFamily);
285     Path splitDirB = new Path(new Path(rootDir,
286         new Path(target, "571B")), columnFamily);
287     StoreFile f = new StoreFile(fs, linkFilePath, conf, cacheConf, BloomType.NONE,
288         NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
289     byte[] splitRow = SPLITKEY;
290     Path pathA = StoreFile.split(fs, splitDirA, f, splitRow, Range.top); // top
291     Path pathB = StoreFile.split(fs, splitDirB, f, splitRow, Range.bottom); // bottom
292 
293     // OK test the thing
294     FSUtils.logFileSystemState(fs, rootDir, LOG);
295 
296     // There is a case where a file with the hfilelink pattern is actually a daughter
297     // reference to a hfile link.  This code in StoreFile that handles this case.
298 
299     // Try to open store file from link
300     StoreFile hsfA = new StoreFile(this.fs, pathA,  conf, cacheConf,
301         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
302 
303     // Now confirm that I can read from the ref to link
304     int count = 1;
305     HFileScanner s = hsfA.createReader().getScanner(false, false);
306     s.seekTo();
307     while (s.next()) {
308       count++;
309     }
310     assertTrue(count > 0); // read some rows here
311 
312     // Try to open store file from link
313     StoreFile hsfB = new StoreFile(this.fs, pathB,  conf, cacheConf,
314         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
315 
316     // Now confirm that I can read from the ref to link
317     HFileScanner sB = hsfB.createReader().getScanner(false, false);
318     sB.seekTo();
319     while (sB.next()) {
320       count++;
321     }
322 
323     // read the rest of the rows
324     assertEquals((LAST_CHAR - FIRST_CHAR + 1) * (LAST_CHAR - FIRST_CHAR + 1), count);
325   }
326 
327   private void checkHalfHFile(final StoreFile f)
328   throws IOException {
329     byte [] midkey = f.createReader().midkey();
330     KeyValue midKV = KeyValue.createKeyValueFromKey(midkey);
331     byte [] midRow = midKV.getRow();
332     // Create top split.
333     Path topDir = Store.getStoreHomedir(this.testDir, "1",
334       Bytes.toBytes(f.getPath().getParent().getName()));
335     if (this.fs.exists(topDir)) {
336       this.fs.delete(topDir, true);
337     }
338     Path topPath = StoreFile.split(this.fs, topDir, f, midRow, Range.top);
339     // Create bottom split.
340     Path bottomDir = Store.getStoreHomedir(this.testDir, "2",
341       Bytes.toBytes(f.getPath().getParent().getName()));
342     if (this.fs.exists(bottomDir)) {
343       this.fs.delete(bottomDir, true);
344     }
345     Path bottomPath = StoreFile.split(this.fs, bottomDir,
346       f, midRow, Range.bottom);
347     // Make readers on top and bottom.
348     StoreFile.Reader top =
349         new StoreFile(this.fs, topPath, conf, cacheConf, BloomType.NONE,
350             NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE).createReader();
351     StoreFile.Reader bottom = new StoreFile(this.fs, bottomPath,
352         conf, cacheConf, BloomType.NONE,
353         NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE).createReader();
354     ByteBuffer previous = null;
355     LOG.info("Midkey: " + midKV.toString());
356     ByteBuffer bbMidkeyBytes = ByteBuffer.wrap(midkey);
357     try {
358       // Now make two HalfMapFiles and assert they can read the full backing
359       // file, one from the top and the other from the bottom.
360       // Test bottom half first.
361       // Now test reading from the top.
362       boolean first = true;
363       ByteBuffer key = null;
364       HFileScanner topScanner = top.getScanner(false, false);
365       while ((!topScanner.isSeeked() && topScanner.seekTo()) ||
366           (topScanner.isSeeked() && topScanner.next())) {
367         key = topScanner.getKey();
368 
369         if (topScanner.getReader().getComparator().compare(key.array(),
370           key.arrayOffset(), key.limit(), midkey, 0, midkey.length) < 0) {
371           fail("key=" + Bytes.toStringBinary(key) + " < midkey=" +
372               Bytes.toStringBinary(midkey));
373         }
374         if (first) {
375           first = false;
376           LOG.info("First in top: " + Bytes.toString(Bytes.toBytes(key)));
377         }
378       }
379       LOG.info("Last in top: " + Bytes.toString(Bytes.toBytes(key)));
380 
381       first = true;
382       HFileScanner bottomScanner = bottom.getScanner(false, false);
383       while ((!bottomScanner.isSeeked() && bottomScanner.seekTo()) ||
384           bottomScanner.next()) {
385         previous = bottomScanner.getKey();
386         key = bottomScanner.getKey();
387         if (first) {
388           first = false;
389           LOG.info("First in bottom: " +
390             Bytes.toString(Bytes.toBytes(previous)));
391         }
392         assertTrue(key.compareTo(bbMidkeyBytes) < 0);
393       }
394       if (previous != null) {
395         LOG.info("Last in bottom: " + Bytes.toString(Bytes.toBytes(previous)));
396       }
397       // Remove references.
398       this.fs.delete(topPath, false);
399       this.fs.delete(bottomPath, false);
400 
401       // Next test using a midkey that does not exist in the file.
402       // First, do a key that is < than first key. Ensure splits behave
403       // properly.
404       byte [] badmidkey = Bytes.toBytes("  .");
405       topPath = StoreFile.split(this.fs, topDir, f, badmidkey, Range.top);
406       bottomPath = StoreFile.split(this.fs, bottomDir, f, badmidkey,
407         Range.bottom);
408       top = new StoreFile(this.fs, topPath, conf, cacheConf,
409           StoreFile.BloomType.NONE,
410           NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE).createReader();
411       bottom = new StoreFile(this.fs, bottomPath, conf, cacheConf,
412           StoreFile.BloomType.NONE,
413           NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE).createReader();
414       bottomScanner = bottom.getScanner(false, false);
415       int count = 0;
416       while ((!bottomScanner.isSeeked() && bottomScanner.seekTo()) ||
417           bottomScanner.next()) {
418         count++;
419       }
420       // When badkey is < than the bottom, should return no values.
421       assertTrue(count == 0);
422       // Now read from the top.
423       first = true;
424       topScanner = top.getScanner(false, false);
425       while ((!topScanner.isSeeked() && topScanner.seekTo()) ||
426           topScanner.next()) {
427         key = topScanner.getKey();
428         assertTrue(topScanner.getReader().getComparator().compare(key.array(),
429           key.arrayOffset(), key.limit(), badmidkey, 0, badmidkey.length) >= 0);
430         if (first) {
431           first = false;
432           KeyValue keyKV = KeyValue.createKeyValueFromKey(key);
433           LOG.info("First top when key < bottom: " + keyKV);
434           String tmp = Bytes.toString(keyKV.getRow());
435           for (int i = 0; i < tmp.length(); i++) {
436             assertTrue(tmp.charAt(i) == 'a');
437           }
438         }
439       }
440       KeyValue keyKV = KeyValue.createKeyValueFromKey(key);
441       LOG.info("Last top when key < bottom: " + keyKV);
442       String tmp = Bytes.toString(keyKV.getRow());
443       for (int i = 0; i < tmp.length(); i++) {
444         assertTrue(tmp.charAt(i) == 'z');
445       }
446       // Remove references.
447       this.fs.delete(topPath, false);
448       this.fs.delete(bottomPath, false);
449 
450       // Test when badkey is > than last key in file ('||' > 'zz').
451       badmidkey = Bytes.toBytes("|||");
452       topPath = StoreFile.split(this.fs, topDir, f, badmidkey, Range.top);
453       bottomPath = StoreFile.split(this.fs, bottomDir, f, badmidkey,
454         Range.bottom);
455       top = new StoreFile(this.fs, topPath, conf, cacheConf,
456           StoreFile.BloomType.NONE,
457           NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE).createReader();
458       bottom = new StoreFile(this.fs, bottomPath, conf, cacheConf,
459           StoreFile.BloomType.NONE,
460           NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE).createReader();
461       first = true;
462       bottomScanner = bottom.getScanner(false, false);
463       while ((!bottomScanner.isSeeked() && bottomScanner.seekTo()) ||
464           bottomScanner.next()) {
465         key = bottomScanner.getKey();
466         if (first) {
467           first = false;
468           keyKV = KeyValue.createKeyValueFromKey(key);
469           LOG.info("First bottom when key > top: " + keyKV);
470           tmp = Bytes.toString(keyKV.getRow());
471           for (int i = 0; i < tmp.length(); i++) {
472             assertTrue(tmp.charAt(i) == 'a');
473           }
474         }
475       }
476       keyKV = KeyValue.createKeyValueFromKey(key);
477       LOG.info("Last bottom when key > top: " + keyKV);
478       for (int i = 0; i < tmp.length(); i++) {
479         assertTrue(Bytes.toString(keyKV.getRow()).charAt(i) == 'z');
480       }
481       count = 0;
482       topScanner = top.getScanner(false, false);
483       while ((!topScanner.isSeeked() && topScanner.seekTo()) ||
484           (topScanner.isSeeked() && topScanner.next())) {
485         count++;
486       }
487       // When badkey is < than the bottom, should return no values.
488       assertTrue(count == 0);
489     } finally {
490       if (top != null) {
491         top.close(true); // evict since we are about to delete the file
492       }
493       if (bottom != null) {
494         bottom.close(true); // evict since we are about to delete the file
495       }
496       fs.delete(f.getPath(), true);
497     }
498   }
499 
500   private static final String localFormatter = "%010d";
501 
502   private void bloomWriteRead(StoreFile.Writer writer, FileSystem fs)
503   throws Exception {
504     float err = conf.getFloat(
505         BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_ERROR_RATE, 0);
506     Path f = writer.getPath();
507     long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
508     for (int i = 0; i < 2000; i += 2) {
509       String row = String.format(localFormatter, i);
510       KeyValue kv = new KeyValue(row.getBytes(), "family".getBytes(),
511         "col".getBytes(), now, "value".getBytes());
512       writer.append(kv);
513     }
514     writer.close();
515 
516     StoreFile.Reader reader = new StoreFile.Reader(fs, f, cacheConf,
517         DataBlockEncoding.NONE);
518     reader.loadFileInfo();
519     reader.loadBloomfilter();
520     StoreFileScanner scanner = reader.getStoreFileScanner(false, false);
521 
522     // check false positives rate
523     int falsePos = 0;
524     int falseNeg = 0;
525     for (int i = 0; i < 2000; i++) {
526       String row = String.format(localFormatter, i);
527       TreeSet<byte[]> columns = new TreeSet<byte[]>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
528       columns.add("family:col".getBytes());
529 
530       Scan scan = new Scan(row.getBytes(),row.getBytes());
531       scan.addColumn("family".getBytes(), "family:col".getBytes());
532       boolean exists = scanner.shouldUseScanner(scan, columns, Long.MIN_VALUE);
533       if (i % 2 == 0) {
534         if (!exists) falseNeg++;
535       } else {
536         if (exists) falsePos++;
537       }
538     }
539     reader.close(true); // evict because we are about to delete the file
540     fs.delete(f, true);
541     assertEquals("False negatives: " + falseNeg, 0, falseNeg);
542     int maxFalsePos = (int) (2 * 2000 * err);
543     assertTrue("Too many false positives: " + falsePos + " (err=" + err
544         + ", expected no more than " + maxFalsePos + ")",
545         falsePos <= maxFalsePos);
546   }
547 
548   public void testBloomFilter() throws Exception {
549     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.getLocal(conf);
550     conf.setFloat(BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_ERROR_RATE,
551         (float) 0.01);
552     conf.setBoolean(BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_ENABLED, true);
553 
554     // write the file
555     Path f = new Path(ROOT_DIR, getName());
556     StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf, fs,
557         StoreFile.DEFAULT_BLOCKSIZE_SMALL)
558             .withFilePath(f)
559             .withBloomType(StoreFile.BloomType.ROW)
560             .withMaxKeyCount(2000)
561             .withChecksumType(CKTYPE)
562             .withBytesPerChecksum(CKBYTES)
563             .build();
564     bloomWriteRead(writer, fs);
565   }
566 
567   public void testDeleteFamilyBloomFilter() throws Exception {
568     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.getLocal(conf);
569     conf.setFloat(BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_ERROR_RATE,
570         (float) 0.01);
571     conf.setBoolean(BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_ENABLED, true);
572     float err = conf.getFloat(BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_ERROR_RATE,
573         0);
574 
575     // write the file
576     Path f = new Path(ROOT_DIR, getName());
577 
578     StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf,
579         fs, StoreFile.DEFAULT_BLOCKSIZE_SMALL)
580             .withFilePath(f)
581             .withMaxKeyCount(2000)
582             .withChecksumType(CKTYPE)
583             .withBytesPerChecksum(CKBYTES)
584             .build();
585 
586     // add delete family
587     long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
588     for (int i = 0; i < 2000; i += 2) {
589       String row = String.format(localFormatter, i);
590       KeyValue kv = new KeyValue(row.getBytes(), "family".getBytes(),
591           "col".getBytes(), now, KeyValue.Type.DeleteFamily, "value".getBytes());
592       writer.append(kv);
593     }
594     writer.close();
595 
596     StoreFile.Reader reader = new StoreFile.Reader(fs, f, cacheConf,
597         DataBlockEncoding.NONE);
598     reader.loadFileInfo();
599     reader.loadBloomfilter();
600 
601     // check false positives rate
602     int falsePos = 0;
603     int falseNeg = 0;
604     for (int i = 0; i < 2000; i++) {
605       String row = String.format(localFormatter, i);
606       byte[] rowKey = Bytes.toBytes(row);
607       boolean exists = reader.passesDeleteFamilyBloomFilter(rowKey, 0,
608           rowKey.length);
609       if (i % 2 == 0) {
610         if (!exists)
611           falseNeg++;
612       } else {
613         if (exists)
614           falsePos++;
615       }
616     }
617     assertEquals(1000, reader.getDeleteFamilyCnt());
618     reader.close(true); // evict because we are about to delete the file
619     fs.delete(f, true);
620     assertEquals("False negatives: " + falseNeg, 0, falseNeg);
621     int maxFalsePos = (int) (2 * 2000 * err);
622     assertTrue("Too many false positives: " + falsePos + " (err=" + err
623         + ", expected no more than " + maxFalsePos, falsePos <= maxFalsePos);
624   }
625 
626   /**
627    * Test for HBASE-8012
628    */
629   public void testReseek() throws Exception {
630     // write the file
631     Path f = new Path(ROOT_DIR, getName());
632 
633     // Make a store file and write data to it.
634     StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf,
635          this.fs, 8 * 1024)
636             .withFilePath(f)
637             .build();
638 
639     writeStoreFile(writer);
640     writer.close();
641 
642     StoreFile.Reader reader = new StoreFile.Reader(fs, f, cacheConf, DataBlockEncoding.NONE);
643 
644     // Now do reseek with empty KV to position to the beginning of the file
645 
646     KeyValue k = KeyValue.createFirstOnRow(HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY);
647     StoreFileScanner s = reader.getStoreFileScanner(false, false);
648     s.reseek(k);
649 
650     assertNotNull("Intial reseek should position at the beginning of the file", s.peek());
651   }
652 
653   public void testBloomTypes() throws Exception {
654     float err = (float) 0.01;
655     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.getLocal(conf);
656     conf.setFloat(BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_ERROR_RATE, err);
657     conf.setBoolean(BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_ENABLED, true);
658 
659     int rowCount = 50;
660     int colCount = 10;
661     int versions = 2;
662 
663     // run once using columns and once using rows
664     StoreFile.BloomType[] bt =
665       {StoreFile.BloomType.ROWCOL, StoreFile.BloomType.ROW};
666     int[] expKeys    = {rowCount*colCount, rowCount};
667     // below line deserves commentary.  it is expected bloom false positives
668     //  column = rowCount*2*colCount inserts
669     //  row-level = only rowCount*2 inserts, but failures will be magnified by
670     //              2nd for loop for every column (2*colCount)
671     float[] expErr   = {2*rowCount*colCount*err, 2*rowCount*2*colCount*err};
672 
673     for (int x : new int[]{0,1}) {
674       // write the file
675       Path f = new Path(ROOT_DIR, getName() + x);
676       StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf,
677           fs, StoreFile.DEFAULT_BLOCKSIZE_SMALL)
678               .withFilePath(f)
679               .withBloomType(bt[x])
680               .withMaxKeyCount(expKeys[x])
681               .withChecksumType(CKTYPE)
682               .withBytesPerChecksum(CKBYTES)
683               .build();
684 
685       long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
686       for (int i = 0; i < rowCount*2; i += 2) { // rows
687         for (int j = 0; j < colCount*2; j += 2) {   // column qualifiers
688           String row = String.format(localFormatter, i);
689           String col = String.format(localFormatter, j);
690           for (int k= 0; k < versions; ++k) { // versions
691             KeyValue kv = new KeyValue(row.getBytes(),
692               "family".getBytes(), ("col" + col).getBytes(),
693                 now-k, Bytes.toBytes((long)-1));
694             writer.append(kv);
695           }
696         }
697       }
698       writer.close();
699 
700       StoreFile.Reader reader = new StoreFile.Reader(fs, f, cacheConf,
701           DataBlockEncoding.NONE);
702       reader.loadFileInfo();
703       reader.loadBloomfilter();
704       StoreFileScanner scanner = reader.getStoreFileScanner(false, false);
705       assertEquals(expKeys[x], reader.generalBloomFilter.getKeyCount());
706 
707       // check false positives rate
708       int falsePos = 0;
709       int falseNeg = 0;
710       for (int i = 0; i < rowCount*2; ++i) { // rows
711         for (int j = 0; j < colCount*2; ++j) {   // column qualifiers
712           String row = String.format(localFormatter, i);
713           String col = String.format(localFormatter, j);
714           TreeSet<byte[]> columns = new TreeSet<byte[]>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
715           columns.add(("col" + col).getBytes());
716 
717           Scan scan = new Scan(row.getBytes(),row.getBytes());
718           scan.addColumn("family".getBytes(), ("col"+col).getBytes());
719           boolean exists =
720               scanner.shouldUseScanner(scan, columns, Long.MIN_VALUE);
721           boolean shouldRowExist = i % 2 == 0;
722           boolean shouldColExist = j % 2 == 0;
723           shouldColExist = shouldColExist || bt[x] == StoreFile.BloomType.ROW;
724           if (shouldRowExist && shouldColExist) {
725             if (!exists) falseNeg++;
726           } else {
727             if (exists) falsePos++;
728           }
729         }
730       }
731       reader.close(true); // evict because we are about to delete the file
732       fs.delete(f, true);
733       System.out.println(bt[x].toString());
734       System.out.println("  False negatives: " + falseNeg);
735       System.out.println("  False positives: " + falsePos);
736       assertEquals(0, falseNeg);
737       assertTrue(falsePos < 2*expErr[x]);
738     }
739   }
740 
741   public void testBloomEdgeCases() throws Exception {
742     float err = (float)0.005;
743     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.getLocal(conf);
744     Path f = new Path(ROOT_DIR, getName());
745     conf.setFloat(BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_ERROR_RATE, err);
746     conf.setBoolean(BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_ENABLED, true);
747     conf.setInt(BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_MAX_KEYS, 1000);
748 
749     // This test only runs for HFile format version 1.
750     conf.setInt(HFile.FORMAT_VERSION_KEY, 1);
751 
752     // this should not create a bloom because the max keys is too small
753     StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf, fs,
754         StoreFile.DEFAULT_BLOCKSIZE_SMALL)
755             .withFilePath(f)
756             .withBloomType(StoreFile.BloomType.ROW)
757             .withMaxKeyCount(2000)
758             .withChecksumType(CKTYPE)
759             .withBytesPerChecksum(CKBYTES)
760             .build();
761     assertFalse(writer.hasGeneralBloom());
762     writer.close();
763     fs.delete(f, true);
764 
765     conf.setInt(BloomFilterFactory.IO_STOREFILE_BLOOM_MAX_KEYS,
766         Integer.MAX_VALUE);
767 
768     // TODO: commented out because we run out of java heap space on trunk
769     // the below config caused IllegalArgumentException in our production cluster
770     // however, the resulting byteSize is < MAX_INT, so this should work properly
771     writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf, fs,
772         StoreFile.DEFAULT_BLOCKSIZE_SMALL)
773             .withFilePath(f)
774             .withBloomType(StoreFile.BloomType.ROW)
775             .withMaxKeyCount(27244696)
776             .build();
777     assertTrue(writer.hasGeneralBloom());
778     bloomWriteRead(writer, fs);
779 
780     // this, however, is too large and should not create a bloom
781     // because Java can't create a contiguous array > MAX_INT
782     writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf, fs,
783         StoreFile.DEFAULT_BLOCKSIZE_SMALL)
784             .withFilePath(f)
785             .withBloomType(StoreFile.BloomType.ROW)
786             .withMaxKeyCount(Integer.MAX_VALUE)
787             .withChecksumType(CKTYPE)
788             .withBytesPerChecksum(CKBYTES)
789             .build();
790     assertFalse(writer.hasGeneralBloom());
791     writer.close();
792     fs.delete(f, true);
793   }
794 
795   public void testFlushTimeComparator() {
796     assertOrdering(StoreFile.Comparators.FLUSH_TIME,
797         mockStoreFile(true, 1000, -1, "/foo/123"),
798         mockStoreFile(true, 1000, -1, "/foo/126"),
799         mockStoreFile(true, 2000, -1, "/foo/126"),
800         mockStoreFile(false, -1, 1, "/foo/1"),
801         mockStoreFile(false, -1, 3, "/foo/2"),
802         mockStoreFile(false, -1, 5, "/foo/2"),
803         mockStoreFile(false, -1, 5, "/foo/3"));
804   }
805 
806   /**
807    * Assert that the given comparator orders the given storefiles in the
808    * same way that they're passed.
809    */
810   private void assertOrdering(Comparator<StoreFile> comparator, StoreFile ... sfs) {
811     ArrayList<StoreFile> sorted = Lists.newArrayList(sfs);
812     Collections.shuffle(sorted);
813     Collections.sort(sorted, comparator);
814     LOG.debug("sfs: " + Joiner.on(",").join(sfs));
815     LOG.debug("sorted: " + Joiner.on(",").join(sorted));
816     assertTrue(Iterables.elementsEqual(Arrays.asList(sfs), sorted));
817   }
818 
819   /**
820    * Create a mock StoreFile with the given attributes.
821    */
822   private StoreFile mockStoreFile(boolean bulkLoad, long bulkTimestamp,
823       long seqId, String path) {
824     StoreFile mock = Mockito.mock(StoreFile.class);
825     Mockito.doReturn(bulkLoad).when(mock).isBulkLoadResult();
826     Mockito.doReturn(bulkTimestamp).when(mock).getBulkLoadTimestamp();
827     if (bulkLoad) {
828       // Bulk load files will throw if you ask for their sequence ID
829       Mockito.doThrow(new IllegalAccessError("bulk load"))
830         .when(mock).getMaxSequenceId();
831     } else {
832       Mockito.doReturn(seqId).when(mock).getMaxSequenceId();
833     }
834     Mockito.doReturn(new Path(path)).when(mock).getPath();
835     String name = "mock storefile, bulkLoad=" + bulkLoad +
836       " bulkTimestamp=" + bulkTimestamp +
837       " seqId=" + seqId +
838       " path=" + path;
839     Mockito.doReturn(name).when(mock).toString();
840     return mock;
841   }
842 
843   /**
844    * Generate a list of KeyValues for testing based on given parameters
845    * @param timestamps
846    * @param numRows
847    * @param qualifier
848    * @param family
849    * @return
850    */
851   List<KeyValue> getKeyValueSet(long[] timestamps, int numRows,
852       byte[] qualifier, byte[] family) {
853     List<KeyValue> kvList = new ArrayList<KeyValue>();
854     for (int i=1;i<=numRows;i++) {
855       byte[] b = Bytes.toBytes(i) ;
856       LOG.info(Bytes.toString(b));
857       LOG.info(Bytes.toString(b));
858       for (long timestamp: timestamps)
859       {
860         kvList.add(new KeyValue(b, family, qualifier, timestamp, b));
861       }
862     }
863     return kvList;
864   }
865 
866   /**
867    * Test to ensure correctness when using StoreFile with multiple timestamps
868    * @throws IOException
869    */
870   public void testMultipleTimestamps() throws IOException {
871     byte[] family = Bytes.toBytes("familyname");
872     byte[] qualifier = Bytes.toBytes("qualifier");
873     int numRows = 10;
874     long[] timestamps = new long[] {20,10,5,1};
875     Scan scan = new Scan();
876 
877     // Make up a directory hierarchy that has a regiondir ("7e0102") and familyname.
878     Path storedir = new Path(new Path(this.testDir, "7e0102"), "familyname");
879     Path dir = new Path(storedir, "1234567890");
880     StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf,
881         this.fs, 8 * 1024)
882             .withOutputDir(dir)
883             .build();
884 
885     List<KeyValue> kvList = getKeyValueSet(timestamps,numRows,
886         family, qualifier);
887 
888     for (KeyValue kv : kvList) {
889       writer.append(kv);
890     }
891     writer.appendMetadata(0, false);
892     writer.close();
893 
894     StoreFile hsf = new StoreFile(this.fs, writer.getPath(), conf, cacheConf,
895         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
896     StoreFile.Reader reader = hsf.createReader();
897     StoreFileScanner scanner = reader.getStoreFileScanner(false, false);
898     TreeSet<byte[]> columns = new TreeSet<byte[]>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
899     columns.add(qualifier);
900 
901     scan.setTimeRange(20, 100);
902     assertTrue(scanner.shouldUseScanner(scan, columns, Long.MIN_VALUE));
903 
904     scan.setTimeRange(1, 2);
905     assertTrue(scanner.shouldUseScanner(scan, columns, Long.MIN_VALUE));
906 
907     scan.setTimeRange(8, 10);
908     assertTrue(scanner.shouldUseScanner(scan, columns, Long.MIN_VALUE));
909 
910     scan.setTimeRange(7, 50);
911     assertTrue(scanner.shouldUseScanner(scan, columns, Long.MIN_VALUE));
912 
913     // This test relies on the timestamp range optimization
914     scan.setTimeRange(27, 50);
915     assertTrue(!scanner.shouldUseScanner(scan, columns, Long.MIN_VALUE));
916   }
917 
918   public void testCacheOnWriteEvictOnClose() throws Exception {
919     Configuration conf = this.conf;
920 
921     // Find a home for our files (regiondir ("7e0102") and familyname).
922     Path baseDir = new Path(new Path(this.testDir, "7e0102"),"twoCOWEOC");
923 
924     // Grab the block cache and get the initial hit/miss counts
925     BlockCache bc = new CacheConfig(conf).getBlockCache();
926     assertNotNull(bc);
927     CacheStats cs = bc.getStats();
928     long startHit = cs.getHitCount();
929     long startMiss = cs.getMissCount();
930     long startEvicted = cs.getEvictedCount();
931 
932     // Let's write a StoreFile with three blocks, with cache on write off
933     conf.setBoolean(CacheConfig.CACHE_BLOCKS_ON_WRITE_KEY, false);
934     CacheConfig cacheConf = new CacheConfig(conf);
935     Path pathCowOff = new Path(baseDir, "123456789");
936     StoreFile.Writer writer = writeStoreFile(conf, cacheConf, pathCowOff, 3);
937     StoreFile hsf = new StoreFile(this.fs, writer.getPath(), conf, cacheConf,
938         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
939     LOG.debug(hsf.getPath().toString());
940 
941     // Read this file, we should see 3 misses
942     StoreFile.Reader reader = hsf.createReader();
943     reader.loadFileInfo();
944     StoreFileScanner scanner = reader.getStoreFileScanner(true, true);
945     scanner.seek(KeyValue.LOWESTKEY);
946     while (scanner.next() != null);
947     assertEquals(startHit, cs.getHitCount());
948     assertEquals(startMiss + 3, cs.getMissCount());
949     assertEquals(startEvicted, cs.getEvictedCount());
950     startMiss += 3;
951     scanner.close();
952     reader.close(cacheConf.shouldEvictOnClose());
953 
954     // Now write a StoreFile with three blocks, with cache on write on
955     conf.setBoolean(CacheConfig.CACHE_BLOCKS_ON_WRITE_KEY, true);
956     cacheConf = new CacheConfig(conf);
957     Path pathCowOn = new Path(baseDir, "123456788");
958     writer = writeStoreFile(conf, cacheConf, pathCowOn, 3);
959     hsf = new StoreFile(this.fs, writer.getPath(), conf, cacheConf,
960         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
961 
962     // Read this file, we should see 3 hits
963     reader = hsf.createReader();
964     scanner = reader.getStoreFileScanner(true, true);
965     scanner.seek(KeyValue.LOWESTKEY);
966     while (scanner.next() != null);
967     assertEquals(startHit + 3, cs.getHitCount());
968     assertEquals(startMiss, cs.getMissCount());
969     assertEquals(startEvicted, cs.getEvictedCount());
970     startHit += 3;
971     scanner.close();
972     reader.close(cacheConf.shouldEvictOnClose());
973 
974     // Let's read back the two files to ensure the blocks exactly match
975     hsf = new StoreFile(this.fs, pathCowOff, conf, cacheConf,
976         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
977     StoreFile.Reader readerOne = hsf.createReader();
978     readerOne.loadFileInfo();
979     StoreFileScanner scannerOne = readerOne.getStoreFileScanner(true, true);
980     scannerOne.seek(KeyValue.LOWESTKEY);
981     hsf = new StoreFile(this.fs, pathCowOn, conf, cacheConf,
982         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
983     StoreFile.Reader readerTwo = hsf.createReader();
984     readerTwo.loadFileInfo();
985     StoreFileScanner scannerTwo = readerTwo.getStoreFileScanner(true, true);
986     scannerTwo.seek(KeyValue.LOWESTKEY);
987     KeyValue kv1 = null;
988     KeyValue kv2 = null;
989     while ((kv1 = scannerOne.next()) != null) {
990       kv2 = scannerTwo.next();
991       assertTrue(kv1.equals(kv2));
992       assertTrue(Bytes.compareTo(
993           kv1.getBuffer(), kv1.getKeyOffset(), kv1.getKeyLength(),
994           kv2.getBuffer(), kv2.getKeyOffset(), kv2.getKeyLength()) == 0);
995       assertTrue(Bytes.compareTo(
996           kv1.getBuffer(), kv1.getValueOffset(), kv1.getValueLength(),
997           kv2.getBuffer(), kv2.getValueOffset(), kv2.getValueLength()) == 0);
998     }
999     assertNull(scannerTwo.next());
1000     assertEquals(startHit + 6, cs.getHitCount());
1001     assertEquals(startMiss, cs.getMissCount());
1002     assertEquals(startEvicted, cs.getEvictedCount());
1003     startHit += 6;
1004     scannerOne.close();
1005     readerOne.close(cacheConf.shouldEvictOnClose());
1006     scannerTwo.close();
1007     readerTwo.close(cacheConf.shouldEvictOnClose());
1008 
1009     // Let's close the first file with evict on close turned on
1010     conf.setBoolean("hbase.rs.evictblocksonclose", true);
1011     cacheConf = new CacheConfig(conf);
1012     hsf = new StoreFile(this.fs, pathCowOff, conf, cacheConf,
1013         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
1014     reader = hsf.createReader();
1015     reader.close(cacheConf.shouldEvictOnClose());
1016 
1017     // We should have 3 new evictions
1018     assertEquals(startHit, cs.getHitCount());
1019     assertEquals(startMiss, cs.getMissCount());
1020     assertEquals(startEvicted + 3, cs.getEvictedCount());
1021     startEvicted += 3;
1022 
1023     // Let's close the second file with evict on close turned off
1024     conf.setBoolean("hbase.rs.evictblocksonclose", false);
1025     cacheConf = new CacheConfig(conf);
1026     hsf = new StoreFile(this.fs, pathCowOn, conf, cacheConf,
1027         StoreFile.BloomType.NONE, NoOpDataBlockEncoder.INSTANCE);
1028     reader = hsf.createReader();
1029     reader.close(cacheConf.shouldEvictOnClose());
1030 
1031     // We expect no changes
1032     assertEquals(startHit, cs.getHitCount());
1033     assertEquals(startMiss, cs.getMissCount());
1034     assertEquals(startEvicted, cs.getEvictedCount());
1035   }
1036 
1037   private StoreFile.Writer writeStoreFile(Configuration conf,
1038       CacheConfig cacheConf, Path path, int numBlocks)
1039   throws IOException {
1040     // Let's put ~5 small KVs in each block, so let's make 5*numBlocks KVs
1041     int numKVs = 5 * numBlocks;
1042     List<KeyValue> kvs = new ArrayList<KeyValue>(numKVs);
1043     byte [] b = Bytes.toBytes("x");
1044     int totalSize = 0;
1045     for (int i=numKVs;i>0;i--) {
1046       KeyValue kv = new KeyValue(b, b, b, i, b);
1047       kvs.add(kv);
1048       // kv has memstoreTS 0, which takes 1 byte to store.
1049       totalSize += kv.getLength() + 1;
1050     }
1051     int blockSize = totalSize / numBlocks;
1052     StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf, fs,
1053         blockSize)
1054             .withFilePath(path)
1055             .withMaxKeyCount(2000)
1056             .withChecksumType(CKTYPE)
1057             .withBytesPerChecksum(CKBYTES)
1058             .build();
1059     // We'll write N-1 KVs to ensure we don't write an extra block
1060     kvs.remove(kvs.size()-1);
1061     for (KeyValue kv : kvs) {
1062       writer.append(kv);
1063     }
1064     writer.appendMetadata(0, false);
1065     writer.close();
1066     return writer;
1067   }
1068 
1069   /**
1070    * Check if data block encoding information is saved correctly in HFile's
1071    * file info.
1072    */
1073   public void testDataBlockEncodingMetaData() throws IOException {
1074     // Make up a directory hierarchy that has a regiondir ("7e0102") and familyname.
1075     Path dir = new Path(new Path(this.testDir, "7e0102"), "familyname");
1076     Path path = new Path(dir, "1234567890");
1077 
1078     DataBlockEncoding dataBlockEncoderAlgo =
1079         DataBlockEncoding.FAST_DIFF;
1080     HFileDataBlockEncoder dataBlockEncoder =
1081         new HFileDataBlockEncoderImpl(
1082             dataBlockEncoderAlgo,
1083             dataBlockEncoderAlgo);
1084     cacheConf = new CacheConfig(conf);
1085     StoreFile.Writer writer = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(conf, cacheConf, fs,
1086         HFile.DEFAULT_BLOCKSIZE)
1087             .withFilePath(path)
1088             .withDataBlockEncoder(dataBlockEncoder)
1089             .withMaxKeyCount(2000)
1090             .withChecksumType(CKTYPE)
1091             .withBytesPerChecksum(CKBYTES)
1092             .build();
1093     writer.close();
1094 
1095     StoreFile storeFile = new StoreFile(fs, writer.getPath(), conf,
1096         cacheConf, BloomType.NONE, dataBlockEncoder);
1097     StoreFile.Reader reader = storeFile.createReader();
1098 
1099     Map<byte[], byte[]> fileInfo = reader.loadFileInfo();
1100     byte[] value = fileInfo.get(HFileDataBlockEncoder.DATA_BLOCK_ENCODING);
1101 
1102     assertEquals(dataBlockEncoderAlgo.getNameInBytes(), value);
1103   }

1105   @org.junit.Rule
1106   public org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ResourceCheckerJUnitRule cu =
1107     new org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ResourceCheckerJUnitRule();
1108 }
